meanings.definition: Anxiety or fear about the future.
meanings.sent1: Her apprehensions about the upcoming test kept her awake at night.
meanings.sent2: His apprehensions about the storm made him stay indoors.
meanings.sent3: The cat's apprehensions about the vacuum cleaner were quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead created apprehensions of an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the house only heightened her apprehensions.

meanings.sent1: The police made several apprehensions during the drug bust.
meanings.sent2: The apprehensions of the suspect were carried out smoothly by the officers.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious scene with mistaken apprehensions of a comedian.
meanings.sent4: The apprehensions of the criminal were swift and efficient.
meanings.sent5: The apprehensions of the thief happened right in front of the crowded market.

meanings.sent1: Her quick apprehensions of the math problem impressed her teacher.
meanings.sent2: The student's apprehensions of the scientific theory were evident in his presentation.
meanings.sent3: The robot's apprehensions of human emotions led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: His apprehensions of the complex algorithm were like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The child's apprehensions of the fairy tale made her eyes light up with excitement.
